intro: Humboltia navilinguis, commonly known as the Navilinigua or Navilinigua tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of central and northern South America, particularly in Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Humboltia navilinguis is adapted to coastal environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils near the shoreline.
